title: Academic Seminar Speaker Preparation & Engagement Planner
description: Upload seminar presentation drafts and speaker profiles to generate tailored speaker readiness reports and customized audience engagement plans. Designed for academic seminar organizers and presenters to collaboratively improve seminar quality with actionable coaching and engagement strategies.
inputLabel: Upload your draft presentation slides or transcript (PDF or text) and enter speaker & seminar details
outputLabel: Speaker readiness report and audience engagement plan
systemPrompt: You are an academic seminar preparation assistant. Given the uploaded draft presentation slides or transcript and detailed speaker profile along with seminar theme and audience characteristics, generate a structured speaker readiness report highlighting strengths, weaknesses, and tailored coaching tips. Also create a customized audience engagement plan recommending Q&A strategies, interactive activities, and timing suggestions. The output must be safe, avoid medical, legal or sensitive advice, and disclaim it is a coaching aid only. Refuse unsupported file formats or disallowed content. Output in plain text or structured JSON if requested. Enforce strict input validation and only provide presentation skill and audience engagement coaching.

presets.label: Balanced report and plan
presets.prompt: Generate a detailed speaker readiness report along with a comprehensive audience engagement plan including Q&A and interactive activities.

presets.label: Focus on coaching tips
presets.prompt: Provide a concise speaker readiness report emphasizing practical coaching tips and improvement areas.

presets.label: Emphasize engagement strategies
presets.prompt: Create an audience engagement plan with detailed timing, activities, and question handling strategies.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured output is requested, provide JSON with keys: 'readinessReport' (summary, strengths[], weaknesses[], coachingTips[]), 'engagementPlan' (activities[], timingRecommendations[], QAStrategies[]), and 'checklist' (tasks[]).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide the seminar theme, speaker experience level, and target audience characteristics to tailor the readiness report and engagement plan.
finalizePrompt: Confirm all input details are correct and submit to generate the speaker readiness report and audience engagement plan.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Seminar Speaker Preparation & Audience Engagement Planner

niche.role: Academic research seminar organizer and presenter
niche.scenario: Preparing seminar speakers with tailored presentation coaching and planning audience engagement strategies before academic research seminars

idea.problem: Academic seminar organizers and presenters lack a dedicated system to collaboratively prepare seminar presentations with structured feedback, speaker coaching, and audience engagement planning. Existing tools focus on scheduling or content generation but do not integrate speaker readiness assessment, customized coaching tips, and interactive engagement plan generation in a repeatable workflow.
inputs: Uploaded draft seminar presentation slides or transcripts
Seminar theme and target audience characteristics
Organizer input on engagement goals and constraints
outputs: Structured speaker readiness report highlighting strengths, weaknesses, and coaching tips
Customized audience engagement plan including Q&A strategies, interactive activities, and timing recommendations
Checklists for last-minute speaker preparation tasks
Collaborative feedback summaries for organizer and speaker review
whyItWins: Addresses a critical gap in seminar preparation by combining speaker coaching and audience engagement planning in one workflow
Supports repeated use for multiple seminars with evolving speaker profiles and feedback integration
Provides actionable, tailored recommendations rather than generic advice, improving seminar quality
Facilitates collaboration between organizers and presenters with shared, structured feedback and planning tools
Lightweight to start but designed to scale into a multi-page app supporting scheduling, speaker management, feedback archives, and live seminar analytics

upgradePath.today: Single-page app to upload draft slides/transcripts and speaker profile to generate a readiness report and basic engagement plan PDF export
upgradePath.in90Days: Add collaborative feedback input, version tracking of presentation drafts, and enhanced tailored coaching content based on speaker experience and audience data
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a multi-page platform with integrated seminar scheduling, speaker dashboard, real-time audience interaction tools, feedback archiving, and AI-driven personalized coaching and engagement simulations

riskNotes: Avoid medical, legal, or sensitive personal advice; focus strictly on presentation skills and engagement strategies
Ensure privacy and secure handling of uploaded presentation and speaker data
Do not attempt to automate evaluation of research content accuracy or peer review
Clearly disclaim the system as a coaching aid, not a definitive assessment of speaker performance or research quality

blueprint.summary: A collaborative platform for academic seminar organizers and presenters to prepare and coach seminar speakers with structured feedback, tailored readiness reports, and customized audience engagement plans, evolving from a single-page upload tool to a comprehensive seminar management and coaching system.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic research seminar organizers and presenters
successMetrics: Number of seminars prepared using the platform
User satisfaction ratings from organizers and speakers
Frequency and quality of collaborative feedback submitted
Repeat usage rate by organizers and speakers
Improvement in seminar engagement metrics (e.g., audience participation, feedback scores)

components.name: Frontend User Interface

components.name: Backend API Server

notes: Processes uploaded slides/transcripts to generate readiness reports.
Manages speaker profiles, seminar data, and feedback versions.

components.name: Database
components.responsibility: Persists user accounts, speaker profiles, seminar details, uploaded materials metadata, feedback entries, readiness reports, engagement plans, and version histories.
notes: Stores sensitive data securely with encryption at rest.
Indexes for fast retrieval of seminar and speaker data.
Supports audit trails for feedback and document versions.

components.name: AI Coaching & Analysis Integration
components.responsibility: Provides AI-powered analysis of presentation drafts and speaker profiles to generate tailored readiness reports, coaching tips, and engagement strategies.
notes: Does not evaluate research content accuracy or provide sensitive advice.
Focuses on presentation skills and audience engagement recommendations.
Supports incremental enhancement of coaching content based on user feedback.

components.name: Feedback Aggregation Background Job
components.responsibility: Periodically aggregates collaborative feedback inputs into summarized reports for organizers and speakers.
notes: Runs on schedule or triggered by feedback submission volume.
Handles conflict resolution and version merging.

components.name: Presentation Version Tracking Job
components.responsibility: Monitors and archives versions of uploaded presentation drafts and transcripts to enable rollback and comparison.

edgeCases: Uploaded files are corrupted or unsupported format - system should reject with clear error.
Multiple users editing feedback or engagement plans simultaneously - handle conflicts gracefully.
Speaker profile data incomplete or inconsistent - provide warnings and allow updates.
AI integration service downtime or slow response - fallback to cached reports or notify users.
Unauthorized access attempts to seminar data - enforce strict auth and role checks.
Large presentation files causing upload timeout - implement chunked upload or size limits.
Missing or incomplete seminar metadata impacting report generation - require minimum fields.
Version conflicts when multiple presentation drafts uploaded rapidly - ensure atomic version increments.
nonGoals: Providing medical, legal, or sensitive personal advice.
Automating evaluation of research content accuracy or peer review.
Replacing human judgment in speaker performance assessment.
Handling live seminar streaming or video conferencing.
Managing general event scheduling outside academic seminars.
Generating presentation content or slides automatically.

dataFlow: User authenticates via frontend; auth token/session managed for API calls.
On /upload page, user submits presentation draft file, speaker profile data, and seminar metadata.
Frontend validates inputs, sends POST /api/uploadDraft with seminarId, speakerId, file, and optional notes.
API backend verifies auth, validates data, stores file securely, creates PresentationDraft record with versioning.
Background job 'Presentation Version Tracking' triggers on new upload to archive version metadata.
API backend calls AI integration service to generate readiness report on demand via POST /api/generateReadinessReport.
AI service returns coaching tips, strengths, weaknesses; backend stores ReadinessReport linked to seminar and speaker.
Frontend dashboard fetches seminars, readiness reports, engagement plans via GET APIs for display.
Users submit feedback via POST /api/submitFeedback with content, rating, related draft version.
Feedback entries stored; background job 'Feedback Aggregation' runs periodically to merge and summarize feedback.
Engagement plans created/edited via POST /api/saveEngagementPlan; retrieved via GET /api/getEngagementPlan.
Checklist items managed via POST /api/manageChecklist and retrieved via GET /api/getChecklist.
Seminar scheduling and metadata managed via POST /api/seminarSchedule; list retrieved via GET /api/getSeminars.
Frontend supports PDF export of reports and engagement plans by fetching data and rendering client-side or server-side.
validationRules: User authentication required for all API routes; reject unauthorized with 401.
File uploads must be PDF or supported transcript formats; reject corrupted or unsupported files with clear error.
Speaker profile fields: email must be valid format; experienceLevel and presentationStyle optional but if present must be from predefined enums.
Seminar metadata requires at minimum title and organizerId; scheduledDate if present must be a valid future date.
PresentationDraft version increments atomically per seminarId and speakerId; reject concurrent conflicting uploads.
Feedback content required, rating optional but if present must be integer between 1 and 5.
Engagement plan planDetails must be valid JSON with required keys (e.g., activities, timing); constraints optional JSON.
Checklist item description required; isCompleted boolean required; assignedToSpeakerId optional but if present must reference existing speaker.
API request bodies validated for required fields and types; reject with 400 and descriptive messages on invalid input.
Prevent submission of incomplete or inconsistent speaker profile data by warning on frontend and allowing updates.
errorHandling: API returns structured error responses with { success: false, error: string } on failures.
File upload errors (size, format, corruption) return 400 with descriptive messages.
Authorization failures (accessing seminars or data user is not permitted to) return 403 Forbidden.
AI integration timeouts or errors return 503 Service Unavailable with fallback to cached reports if available.
Conflict errors on version increments or simultaneous edits return 409 Conflict with instructions to retry.
Background jobs log errors and retry on transient failures; notify admins on persistent failures.
Frontend displays user-friendly error messages and guides corrective actions.
Validation errors return 400 with field-specific messages to assist user correction.
securityNotes: All API routes require authentication; use secure session or JWT tokens.
Role-based access control enforced in backend: organizers can manage seminars and assign speakers; speakers can upload drafts and view own data.
Sensitive data (passwords) stored hashed with strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt).
Data at rest encrypted in database for sensitive fields.
File uploads scanned and stored securely with access controls.
Audit trails maintained for feedback and document versions for accountability.
Rate limiting and input sanitization to prevent abuse and injection attacks.
Strict CORS policies configured for frontend-backend communication.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communication.
Ensure AI integration does not expose sensitive user data; sanitize inputs and outputs.
